clues.text: Lithotripsy uses shock waves to break up these, allowing them to pass more easily out of the body (& without surgery)
The health benefits of this element, at. No. 12, are said to include preventing migraines & improving sleep
The first word in this 3-word cardiac condition refers to the buildup of fluid in the body; the last means the pump isn't keeping up
An allergic reaction may cause these, also called urticaria
Too much cortisol can cause this adrenal syndrome; the same-named disease is caused by secretion of ACTH by a pituitary tumor
NASA says this kind of food retains 98% of its nutrition at 20% of its original weight
This French word can mean a meeting, planned or unplanned
A hammered dulcimer called a tsimbl is featured in this genre of music
The compression of crystals like quartz produces this type of charge
This word for a stone with purported healing powers comes from a Persian term for "antidote"
Changing which Bill paid her bills, this "Peerless Lady Wing Shot" left Buffalo Bill for Pawnee Bill's Frontier Exhibition

The Society of Friends expelled her in 1794 when she married James but in 1809, she made new friends as first lady

What would become Exxon, Mobil, Amoco & Chevron were all part of this company that got dissolved in 1911
Also a prefix in front of "-fiche" or "-cosm", it describes the itty-bitty
Dizygotic twins are this type of twins from 2 eggs
Don't get verklempt when I tell you your hair is all this word for messy that also ends in "PT"

Opposite windward, it's the side of a boat sheltered from the wind

A 2023 book about this lifestyle clothing retailer is called "The Kingdom of Prep"
A logo of a fella just wearing his silks has been used by this underwear retailer

The slogan of this place that offers "quick" oil changes is "Leave Worry Behind"

rounds.category: THE HIGHEST POPULATION IN THE STATE

clues.text: Let's head to the Bourbon District in downtown this city, the largest in its commonwealth
About a 7-hour drive from West Virginia to South Carolina on I-77 & I-26 will take you from one biggest city called this to another
A city with this name has the highest population in 2 coastal states
I'm goin' to this city in Kansas, about 140 miles from Topeka forevermore / It's on the Arkansas, & grown a lot since 1864

This 3-word phrase often follows "Police Line" in black letters on yellow tape

rounds.category: GEOLOGIC TIME DIVISIONS AS FRIENDS EPISODE TITLES

clues.text:
The Late Jurassic:
"The One Where" these land animals "Dominated "

The Hadean Eon:
"The One Where We Think" this celestial body "Formed by a Collision"

The Cryogenian Period:
"The One Where Earth Iced Over & Looked Like" one of these projectiles

The Carnian Pluvial episode:
"The One Where It" did this "for 2 Million Years"

The Permian mass extinction:
"The One Where" the last of these 3-segmented marine arthropods "Bites the Dust"
1960's "The Button-Down Mind of" this standup comic & future TV star topped the Billboard album chart & won a Grammy
The ancient comic plays of Aristophanes include this one where a group decides to build a utopia in the sky
This film comedy duo began in the silent era with "Putting Pants on Philip" in 1927
Richard Sheridan's 1775 comedy of manners "The Rivals" features this character known for the misuse of words
Full of colorful anecdotes, this 1872 travel journal by Mark Twain recounted a stagecoach journey out West
When John Bean took a shot at her in 1842, cops arrested every man in London with curvature of the spine like John's
Considering him a usurper, in 1402 Jing Qing plotted to kill Zhu Di, the third emperor of this dynasty
Carlito Dimahilig's attempt to kill this first lady in 1972 was thwarted in part by her using her shoes as a defense
Giuseppe Zangara's attempt on FDR's life in 1933 instead ended up killing Anton Cermak, mayor of this city
A Booth accomplice who shared the name of a 20th c. Supreme Court justice, he carved up but failed to kill William Seward
2021's "The Rescue" chronicles the rescue of 12 boys & their soccer coach from deep inside a flooded cave in this country
Filmed in Antarctica, this nature doc is one of the few that got a sequel: "The Next Step"
He kind of directed & kind of appears in "Exit Through the Gift Shop", about street artists, though he's mostly in the shadows
This Russian opposition leader who survived a poisoning but died in a penal colony was the subject of a 2022 doc
A 2024 Oscar winner, "The Only Girl in the Orchestra" tells of double bassist Orin O'Brien, hired by him for the N.Y. philharmonic
The makers of Aran Islands sweaters, made from 100% natural this fabric, assure us their garments are non-itchy
Ezekiel 1:28 mentions this pleasing sight that more famously appears in Genesis 9
This dairy-sounding quality of some Chardonnay, the result of a second fermentation, is the name of a Josh Cellars wine
At the end of "Say Anything", this sound tells Ione Skye everything will be okay
Despite the meaning of its French name, this Nina Ricci perfume is timeless & 2023 marked its 75th anniversary

rounds.text: Referring to what's wrongly believed to be a meteorite, "The Falling Star" is the title of Chapter 2 of this 1898 novel
